review: I got this primarily so I could watch Amazon Prime Instant Video in my bedroom and this works great. A lot of the other channels are subscription only or are channels I'll likely never watch. Sure you can "install" a lot of the other channels for free, but try to watch something without a credit card, it ain't happening! This device has locked up on me a few times when turning the TV off for 24 hours, leaving this device at, say, the screen showing all episodes for whatever show I was watching, then turning it back on to find this device frozen. Sometimes just hitting the Home button on the remote will take you to the home screen but once I had to unplug the power from this to get it to respond, this was a PITA on a 60" DLP TV that has it's ports in the center of the TV and the TV was pushed against the wall on top of a dresser. Luckily this only has happened once so far. All in all this device is VERY responsive though there has been several times that it "lost" my Wi-Fi signal in the middle of the show. I don't think it's my brand new $200 router. It always reconnects, but sometimes I have to go to the home screen and go through the network setup again then go back to my show. Pretty annoying. I'm still pretty happy with it. Before this I bought a Chromecast and returned it the next day, but that'another story. ;o)

review: When I purchased my Samsung LCD over a year ago, I kicked myself for not purchasing a smart model. Some deemed these as unecessary but I prefer to keep my devices segmented for their intended usage. Game consoles, in my opinion, are meant solely for gaming. The same applies to blu-ray players. The roku media stick definitely amends this issue.Netflix, Hulu and Blockbluster are all included. Additional apps, such as Plex, can be purchased from the Roku store.  This device is nimble and small.  It can either be powered via an a/c adapter or a free usb on your tv or through your tv provider's stb. I only encountered two cons with this device:1. Heat: After about 20 or so minutes of usage, this device becomes rather hot. This is to be expected as this unit is compact and therefore has no integrated cooling mechanisms.2. Slow Start-Up: The initial start-up of this Roku takes approximately 30-45 seconds. This occurs whenever you're starting it for usage. The Roku splash screen is visible but no other warnings about loading are present.If you were like me and decided against a smart tv, this device will bridge that gap.
